item.title: 据《纽约时报》报道，索尼和阿波罗推进派拉蒙竞购进程，但对早先的计划保持沉默
item.description: 据《纽约时报》周五援引知情人士的话报道，索尼影视娱乐公司和阿波罗全球管理公司已签署保密协议，允许他们在可能竞购派拉蒙电影公司资产之前查看派拉蒙的账目。【原文：Sony Pictures Entertainment and Apollo Global Management have signed nondisclosure agreements that will allow them to look at Paramount's books ahead of a potential bid for the movie studio's assets, the New York Times reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 为检查氦气泄漏，波音 "星际客机 "首次载人飞行再次推迟
item.description: 美国国家航空航天局（NASA）和波音公司周五表示，波音公司的 "星际客舱"（Starliner crew capsule）再次推迟发射时间，以便在尝试将飞船的前两名宇航员送入太空之前，再用四天时间对氦气泄漏问题进行评估。【原文：NASA and Boeing delayed the launch of Boeing's Starliner crew capsule again on Friday, giving them four more days to assess a helium leak before attempting to launch the spacecraft's first two astronauts into space, the space agency said Friday.】

item.title: 加密贷款机构 Genesis 在破产清算中向客户返还 30 亿美元
item.description: 加密贷款机构 Genesis Global 周五获得法院批准，在破产清算中将约 30 亿美元的现金和加密货币返还给客户，但其所有者数字货币集团（Digital Currency Group）却无法从破产中获得任何补偿。【原文：Crypto lender Genesis Global received court approval on Friday to return about $3 billion in cash and cryptocurrency to its customers in a bankruptcy liquidation, leaving its owner, Digital Currency Group, with no recovery from the bankruptcy.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，日本主要谈判代表将在匹兹堡会见美国钢铁公司员工
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五援引知情人士的话报道，日本新日铁公司副董事长兼美国钢铁交易的主要谈判代表森隆弘（Takahiro Mori）将于下周前往宾夕法尼亚州匹兹堡，与当地工作人员和民选官员会面。【原文：Japan's Nippon Steel's vice chairman and key negotiator for the U.S. Steel deal, Takahiro Mori, will travel to Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania next week to meet with local staff and elected officials, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people briefed on the matter.】

item.title: UAW 在阿拉巴马州的惨痛失利不会扼杀全国性的组织工作
item.description: 美国汽车工人联合会（United Auto Workers）在阿拉巴马州组织梅赛德斯-奔驰（Mercedes-Benz）工厂的努力失败了，但劳工教授和分析家们说，周五的失利对于在一个历来反对工会的州进行的首次努力来说是个不错的结果。【原文：The United Auto Workers failed in its effort to organize a Mercedes-Benz plant in Alabama, but the loss on Friday was a good result for a first effort in a historically anti-union state, labor professors and analysts said.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 股市创纪录的反弹可能还有很长的路要走
item.description: 本周，美国股市创下历史新高，如果以史为鉴，这轮反弹可能还有更长的路要走。【原文：A rebound that has taken the U.S. stock market to record highs this week may have further to run, if history is any guide.】

item.title: 由 J&J 支持的初创公司 Rapport 申请在美国上市
item.description: 由强生公司风险投资部门支持的生物制药公司 Rapport Therapeutics 周五在美国提交了首次公开募股申请。【原文：Biopharmaceutical company Rapport Therapeutics, backed by the venture capital arm of Johnson & Johnson , filed for an initial public offering in the United States on Friday.】

item.title: 美国和 TikTok 寻求快速通道，在 12 月 6 日前就潜在禁令做出裁决
item.description: 美国司法部和 TikTok 周五要求美国上诉法院设定一个快速审理时间表，以审理对一项新法律提出的法律挑战，该法律要求中国字节跳动公司在 1 月 19 日前剥离 TikTok 在美国的资产，否则将面临禁令。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department and TikTok on Friday asked a U.S. appeals court to set a fast-track schedule to consider the legal challenges to a new law requiring Chinese-based ByteDance to divest TikTok's U.S. assets by Jan. 19 or face a ban.】

item.title: 瑞典电动汽车制造商 Polestar 收到纳斯达克潜在退市通知
item.description: 瑞典电动汽车公司 Polestar 周五表示，纳斯达克交易所通知其不符合该交易所关于及时向美国证券监管机构提交公司年度报告的上市规则。【原文：Swedish electric vehicle firm Polestar said on Friday it was notified by the Nasdaq for not meeting the exchange's listing rules related to the timely filing of the company's annual report with the U.S. securities regulator.】

item.title: 好时因里斯糖果图案缺失面临更大规模诉讼
item.description: 好时公司再次面临更大规模的诉讼，称其误导消费者，让消费者在打开包装后发现几款里斯花生酱糖果上的艺术细节。【原文：Hershey is facing a renewed, larger lawsuit claiming it misled consumers about the amount of artistic detail they would find on several Reese's peanut butter candies after opening the packaging.】

item.title: 据 Information 报道，苹果公司将于 2025 年发布更轻薄的 iPhone
item.description: 据《信息报》周五援引三位知情人士的话报道，苹果公司正在开发一款更轻薄的 iPhone，很可能在 2025 年推出。【原文：Apple is developing a slimmer version of the iPhone that is likely to be launched by 2025, the Information reported on Friday, citing three people with knowledge of the project.】

item.title: 对冲流动 高盛称，对冲基金在 "僵尸股 "飙升的背景下被挤出空头赌注
item.description: 路透社周五看到的一份高盛公司（Goldman）的报告显示，由于美国概念股大幅反弹，对冲基金在本周初放弃了看跌股票的押注，其比例为三年来最高。【原文：Hedge funds ditched bearish stock bets early this week at some of the highest rates in three years as U.S. meme stocks rallied sharply, a Goldman note seen by Reuters on Friday showed.】

item.title: 波音公司在 MAX 中空门塞爆炸后面临多项调查
item.description: 继 1 月 5 日阿拉斯加航空公司一架 737 MAX 9 飞机发生面板爆炸事故后，波音公司正面临美国监管机构和检察官对其安全和质量做法的更严格审查。【原文：Boeing is facing heightened scrutiny from U.S. regulators and prosecutors into its safety and quality practices following the Jan. 5 panel blowout on an Alaska Airlines 737 MAX 9.】

item.title: 美联储鲍曼重申她愿意在必要时加息
item.description: 美国联邦储备局局长米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）周五重申了她的观点，即在政策利率保持稳定的情况下，通胀率将进一步下降，但她表示，今年通胀率没有改善，如果进展停滞或逆转，她仍愿意加息。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman on Friday repeated her view that inflation will fall further with the policy rate held steady, but said she has seen no improvement on inflation this year and remains willing to hike rates should progress stall or reverse.】

item.title: 海底捞餐饮运营商 Super Hi 股价大涨 38%，强势登陆美国市场
item.description: Super Hi International 在纳斯达克首次上市就大涨了 38%，使这家中国连锁火锅店海鲜楼的运营商估值达到约 17.4 亿美元。【原文：Super Hi International , jumped 38% in its debut on Nasdaq, giving the operator of Chinese hotpot restaurant chain Haidilao a valuation of about $1.74 billion.】

item.title: 在人工智能的推动下，BuzzFeed 首席执行官转而采用以股票为基础的多数薪酬制度
item.description: 数字媒体公司 BuzzFeed 首席执行官乔纳-佩雷蒂（Jonah Peretti）周五表示，在努力推动采用人工智能以加快扭亏为盈的同时，他的薪酬中将有很大一部分是股票期权。【原文：A major part of BuzzFeed CEO Jonah Peretti's compensation will now be in stock options, the digital media firm said on Friday, amid efforts to boost the adoption of artificial intelligence to speed up a turnaround.】

item.title: 美联储主席鲍威尔 COVID-19 检测呈阳性，在家办公
item.description: 美联储发言人在一份电子邮件声明中说，美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔周四的 COVID-19 检测呈阳性，目前正在家中工作。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell tested positive for COVID-19 on Thursday and is currently working from home, a Fed spokesperson said in an emailed statement.】

item.title: 本周备忘录股狂热之后，GameStop 因增资计划而暴跌
item.description: 零售业的宠儿 GameStop 上周五大跌 26%，因为这家陷入困境的电子游戏零售商表示，将利用本周的 "备忘录股 "热潮出售最多 4,500 万股股票。【原文：Retail darling GameStop slumped 26% on Friday after the struggling videogame retailer said it would sell up to 45 million shares, taking advantage of the meme-stocks frenzy this week.】

item.title: 波音股东投票选举首席执行官卡尔霍恩连任董事会成员
item.description: 据初步统计，波音公司股东在公司年度会议上投票选举即将离任的首席执行官戴夫-卡尔霍恩（Dave Calhoun）连任该公司董事会成员。【原文：Boeing Co shareholders voted to re-elect outgoing Chief Executive Dave Calhoun to the planemaker's board at the company's annual meeting, as per a preliminary tally.】

item.title: 法官裁定，可要求 Citgo 股份竞标者如何满足债券持有人的要求
item.description: 美国地区法院法官周五裁定，在美国法院举行的决定炼油商 Citgo Petroleum (PDVSAC.UL) 所有权的股票拍卖会上，可以要求竞标者说明其具有约束力的报价是否涵盖委内瑞拉债券持有人在另一起法院诉讼中提出的索赔。【原文：Bidders in a U.S. court auction of shares that will decide the ownership of oil refiner Citgo Petroleum (PDVSAC.UL) can be required to say if their binding offers cover claims by Venezuela bondholders in a separate court action, a U.S. District Court judge ruled on Friday.】

item.title: 下周德克萨斯州五月份电力需求将创历史新高
item.description: 德克萨斯州电网运营商周五预计，随着家庭和企业为躲避春季热浪而开动空调，下周德克萨斯州的用电量将可能打破五月份的记录。【原文：Power use in Texas will likely break records for the month of May next week as homes and businesses crank up their air conditioners to escape a spring heat wave, the state's electric grid operator projected on Friday.】

item.title: 加拿大广播公司（CBC）报道：加拿大安全情报局局长警告中国可利用 TikTok 监视用户
item.description: 据加拿大广播公司（CBC News）周五报道，加拿大安全情报局局长警告加拿大人不要使用视频应用程序 TikTok，称从其用户那里收集的数据 "可供中国政府使用"。【原文：The head of Canada's Security Intelligence Service warned Canadians against using video app TikTok, saying data gleaned from its users "is available to the government of China," CBC News reported on Friday.】

item.title: 纽约联储宣布推出新的供应链压力指标
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行正在加强其追踪供应链状况的数据产品。【原文：The Federal Reserve Bank of New York is bolstering its data offerings tracking the state of supply chains.】

item.title: 美国银行将以 29 亿美元收购华联银行的多户贷款组合
item.description: 华盛顿联邦银行（Washington Federal Bank）周五同意以约 29 亿美元的价格向美国银行（Bank of America）出售商业多户房地产贷款组合，帮助这家地区性贷款机构减少在这一问题领域的风险敞口。【原文：Washington Federal Bank agreed on Friday to sell a portfolio of commercial multi-family real estate loans to Bank of America for about $2.9 billion, helping the regional lender cut its exposure to the troubled sector.】

item.title: 行业反弹后，美国对 G7 俄罗斯钻石禁令态度冷淡
item.description: 七位消息人士称，在非洲国家、印度宝石抛光商和纽约珠宝商的反对下，美国正在重新评估禁止俄罗斯钻石进入七大民主国家集团的最严格内容。【原文：The United States is re-evaluating the strictest elements of a ban on Russian diamonds from the Group of Seven major democracies, after opposition from African countries, Indian gem polishers and New York jewellers, seven sources said.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：特斯拉董事长认为马斯克薪酬方案获得股东投票面临挑战
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周五报道，特斯拉董事会主席表示，该公司需要攀登 "珠穆朗玛峰"，因为它面临着股东对迁往得克萨斯州和首席执行官埃隆-马斯克 560 亿美元薪酬协议的投票。【原文：Tesla's chair of the board said the company needs to climb "Mount Everest" as it faces shareholder votes on relocating to Texas and CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay deal, the Financial Times reported on Friday.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，微软计划通过订阅服务发布下一版《使命召唤
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周五报道，微软计划在其订阅服务中发布新一期的《使命召唤》电子游戏，而不是长期以来只采用自选销售的方式。【原文：Microsoft plans to release the coming installment of "Call of Duty" videogame to its subscription service instead of the longtime approach of only selling it à la carte, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.】

item.title: 美国劳工委员会将暂停审理针对 SpaceX 的案件，等待该公司提出法律挑战
item.description: 美国国家劳资关系委员会告诉德克萨斯州的一名联邦法官，将暂停审理指控 SpaceX 非法解雇批评首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的工程师的案件，同时该火箭制造商将继续声称该机构的内部执法程序是非法的。【原文：The U.S. National Labor Relations Board told a Texas federal judge that it will suspend a case accusing SpaceX of illegally firing engineers critical of CEO Elon Musk while the rocket maker pursues claims that the agency's in-house enforcement proceedings are illegal.】

item.title: 美国股票基金创八周来最大单周流入量
item.description: 截至 5 月 15 日的七天内，美国股票基金吸引了大量资金流入，原因是在美国就业数据低迷和通胀数据低于预期的情况下，市场对美联储降息的预期推波助澜。【原文：U.S. equity funds attracted significant inflows in the seven days to May 15, fuelled by expectations of Federal Reserve rate cuts following subdued U.S. jobs data and a softer-than-anticipated inflation reading.】

item.title: 贝莱德首席执行官认为欧洲因人工智能电力需求而面临 "巨大问题
item.description: 贝莱德公司首席执行官周五表示，支持人工智能（AI）技术的数据中心所需的巨大电力供应将造成各国之间的竞争问题，并使欧洲处于不利地位。【原文：The enormous power supply required by data centres to support artificial intelligence (AI) technologies will create competitive issues among countries and put Europe at a disadvantage, the CEO of BlackRock said on Friday.】
